metadata.synopsis: Teenage drummer Jimmy Connors (Mickey Rooney) dreams of winning the contest for school bands hosted by popular band leader Paul Whiteman (himself). In order to enter, Jimmy and his pals, including charming vocalist Mary Holden (Judy Garland), must accumulate $200 for the train ride to Chicago, where the contest will be held. Jimmy and his friends decide to put on an epic student play to raise the funds they need, but a sudden illness threatens to cost the band their chance.

reviews: It's always a pleasure to hear Garland sing, and the fevered and frenzied Rooney is something to behold. But the story is awfully thin.
Rooney and Garland are full of effervescent charm, and Berkeley delivers some of his strongest numbers of his MGM period.
Despite the tiresome plot, it's highly entertaining because of the snappy young duo and their big band music.
One of the most popular Mickey Rooney-Judy Garland teamings of lets put on a show, directed by Busby Berkeley
